detected.text: While traveling, your sensors detect an object in the distance obstructing your trajectory. Looking ahead, you see nothing but the deep black and starry void.

options.text: Continue with the current trajectory unchanged
Slightly alter trajectory to avoid the unidentified object

details.text: Alert, you continue on your original path with elevated curiosity. You see nothing yourself, but the computer is collecting more details about the foreign object. It's radiating with low levels of infrared light, tubular in shape, and roughly twice the volume of your ship.

options.text: Change path before getting too close

slightlyalter.text: You expend some energy to avoid the object. This is no place for gambling or senseless curiosity.

doubt.text: Caution and curiosity thrust your attention directly ahead. Still, you see nothing and transient doubts leak from between your thoughts. The computer has misidentified objects in the past; albeit none this substantial. Perhaps something is interfering with its sensors.

options.text: Check readings for a possible source of interference

interference.text: You slowly avert your gaze and analyze the sensor data for anomalies. Nothing unusual.

sighted.text: Mild paranoia. It's still too early to warrant checking for interference or broken equipment. Moments later, your persistence proves valuable when you spot an enormous worm-like creature fast advancing toward your ship. With a massive burst from your engines, you're able to veer out of its blind path just in time to avoid a devastating impact. Shaken, you manage to realign to your original course.

unexpected.text: Confused, you sigh and turn from the computer to look back into the empty space ahead. Your eyes don't adjust and you blink, but suddenly you're taken aback by a terrible realization: there's a giant space worm hurtling toward your ship. You blast your engines sidewards but the creature is too close to avoid impact. Wreckage flies in all directions. Parts of your hull are left twisted and shredded in a bloody nebula of worm an steel.
